topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54723ae96368720a299c0000#post_54723ae96368720a299c0000
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54723b686368721cc2440200#post_54723b686368721cc2440200
On the plus side the usa's government hasn't been listening to voters for so fucking long that they're all going to be in for a *very* nasty shock in 2016.

If you're wondering what I mean by this is that history wise in the usa there's occassional periods in politics in which the government doesn't listen to voters for so long that eventually it reaches the point in which they can't realistically shift fast enough in order to accomodate the cultural changes since they stopped listening.

If you're wondering what I mean by this is that in 2016:
Republicans, "Eh; we're going to get re-elected anyhow.  We don't have to bother listening to the voters even if we lose the election."
Democrats, "Eh; we're probably going to win the presidency anyhow.  We don't have to bother listening to the voters even if we did lose the election.'
*after election*
Both, "*HOLY FUCKING SHITBALLS!*"
Voters, "listening now assholes?"


Call me crazy, but if I had to take a wild guess in ten years time the majority of congress is going to be replaced because with the last couple of elections while the majority of people did get re-elected there was a shocking number of new faces.  There was a ton of new faces the last two elections; eventually all the old members are going to get replaced.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54724001636872770cab0000#post_54724001636872770cab0000
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54723dcb6368720e1e3e0200#post_54723dcb6368720e1e3e0200
I have to ask. What could happen that would make bother parties  worry? Aside from everyone not voting or somehow everyone does a third party.[/bq]
Tl:dr; they get replaced by new guys.  The last two elections nearly two hundred seats have been replaced by new faces.  Sure the people at the top are the same, but the nobodies that nobody can remember their name to, unless they live in the district, keep getting booted out.

Eventually at this rate even the people at top are going to be replaced.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5472424d6368725e573c0200#post_5472424d6368725e573c0200
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54724139636872784bb10100#post_54724139636872784bb10100
How could we know that these new people are not as bad, or even worse than their predecessors? You know, history repeats itself.[/bq]
It straight up doesn't matter at this point; it's better to throw them all out knowing full well the new guys are probably going to be shit as well rather than let the current ones keep their jobs.

To use a analogy that's like going at a place of work, "well sure employee #427 went on a manic episode and slashed everyone's tires, exploded the toilets, smashed all the windows in the office and humped the fax machine, but maybe we should keep him because how do we know the new replacement won't be worse?"

The current members are so bad that it's better to get rid of them and take a risk with the new members than to let the current ones continue to work in congress.

And secondly you're proposing the destruction of democracy.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
